clusters.title: Man charged over murder of Sydney woman found dead in burnt-out car
clusters.neutral_headline: Man Charged in Sydney Woman's Murder
bullet_summary: A man has been charged over the alleged kidnapping and murder of a Sydney woman after her body was found in a burnt car in April

items.title: Man charged over murder of Sydney woman found dead in burnt-out car
items.standfirst: A man has been charged over the alleged kidnapping and murder of a Sydney woman after her body was found in a burnt car in April.
items.content: A man has been charged over the alleged kidnapping and murder of a Sydney woman after her body was found in a burnt car in April.Police allege Thi Kim Tran, 45, originally from Vietnam, was at her home in Bankstown on April 17 when a group of masked men forced their way into the property and kidnapped her at gunpoint.During the incident, police were told the alleged kidnappers assaulted an eight-year-old boy with a baseball bat before forcing her into an SUV. A 15-year-old boy was also in the home at the time.READ MORE: Police descend on home amid search for alleged cop killer Tran's remains were found in the torched SUV in Beverly Hills.Police believe Tran and the children were likely targeted as a result of her husband's alleged involvement with a criminal drug crime network based in Victoria. He has not been charged over his alleged involvement in the criminal group.Police raided a unit in Bankstown yesterday and arrested a 29-year-old man.He was charged with murder and was refused bail to appear before Bankstown Local Court today.Police will allege in court the man facilitated Tran's kidnapping and murder and was involved in the assault of the eight-year-old boy.The man who was arrested is not alleged to have killed Tran himself, but is alleged to have brought the three men who did to her home and facilitated the murder.Evidence suggested Tran was shot before the SUV was set alight with her body in it, NSW Police homicide squad commander Joe Doueihi said today. Investigations under Strike Force Bushfield are ongoing and detectives are still working to track down the three men alleged to have kidnapped and killed Tran.The eight-year-old boy has made a good recovery from the serious head injuries he sustained in the attack, Doueihi said.A relative of Tran's took to social media at the time of her death, calling on the government for justice to be served.The family member posted an Instagram comment asking "the local government [to] return justice to [Tran].Another friend, who didn't want to be named, told the Sydney Morning Herald what happened was "so awful"."She didn't deserve this. She was a loving mother. Everyone is in shock," they said.

items.title: Man charged with murder of Sydney woman whose body was found in burnt-out car
items.standfirst: Police have arrested a man they say facilitated the kidnapping and murder of Sydney woman Thi Kim Tran over her husband's alleged ties to a Melbourne drug cartel.
items.content: Police have arrested a man they say facilitated the kidnapping and murder of Sydney woman Thi Kim Tran over her husband's alleged ties to a Melbourne drug cartel.

ai_summary: A man has been charged with the murder of a Sydney woman.
The woman's body was found in a burnt-out car in April.
The man is charged with facilitating the kidnapping and murder.

items.title: How Iran's antisemitic attack plot came undone
items.standfirst: After months of painstaking investigation, Australia's top spooks last week unpicked the thread confirming a link between the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps and antisemitic attacks in Sydney and Melbourne.
items.content: After months of painstaking investigation, Australia's top spooks last week unpicked the thread confirming a link between the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps and antisemitic attacks in Sydney and Melbourne.

ai_summary: Australia's intelligence agencies investigated antisemitic attacks.
The attacks occurred in Sydney and Melbourne.
The investigation confirmed a link to the IRGC.
The Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps was implicated.
The investigation took months to complete.
